title: Peptidoglycan synthesis gene detector
description: This feature specifically detects genomic regions containing murB and murC genes, which encode key enzymes in bacterial peptidoglycan biosynthesis. The feature shows strong, localized activation directly over or immediately adjacent to these genes across diverse bacterial phyla. These genes catalyze essential early steps in cell wall precursor synthesis: MurB reduces UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvate to UDP-N-acetylmuramate, while MurC adds L-alanine to UDP-N-acetylmuramate. The feature appears most active in bacteria with peptidoglycan cell walls and shows consistent activation patterns regardless of neighboring genes, suggesting it's detecting conserved sequence features within murB/murC themselves rather than operon context. The consistency across phylogenetically diverse organisms indicates these sequences are highly conserved due to their essential function in bacterial cell wall synthesis.
